newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Sturgeon fish pushed into CITES safety net.
newsitem.headline: Sturgeon fish pushed into CITES safety net.

text.p: A world conference on endangered species has placed sturgeon fish -- the source of caviar -- on a list of animals facing extinction and which can only be traded under strict control.

Officials at the 10-day Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES) said the conference had accepted late on Wednesday by consensus a proposal sponsored by the United States and Germany to help protect this valuable fish by listing it under CITES's Appendix II.
"It slipped into the safety net when the whole world was looking at the elephant," Izgrev Topkov, secretary-general of the 138-member CITES told Reuters.
He was referring to the heated debate over ivory trade and the African elephant which dominated the Zimbabwe CITES meeting which ends on Friday.

The United States and Germany, and many leading environmental pressure groups, say the sturgeon has come under threat from poaching and overfishing in the Caspian Sea basin, home to about 90 percent of the fish.
The sturgeon had become particularly vulnerable with the collapse of the former Soviet Union, they said.
